issues: Missing BUN and/or creatinine values for BUN/creatinine ratio
Lab timestamps not provided, affecting lab staleness assessment
Hemodynamic instability (low MAP and SBP) may increase risk of contrast administration
recommendations: Proceed with emergent contrast‑enhanced CT/CTA as per protocol
Obtain missing laboratory values (BUN, potassium, BMI) as soon as possible and monitor renal function post‑contrast
Ensure adequate fluid resuscitation and hemodynamic support before contrast administration due to low MAP
Document discussion of renal and hemodynamic risks, obtain consent, and monitor creatinine post‑procedure
Consider alternative imaging if patient's hemodynamic status deteriorates before imaging
